xss.recommendation: Implement proper input validation and output encoding. Use Content Security Policy (CSP) headers.
xss.description: Cross-Site Scripting allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users.

sqli.recommendation: Use parameterized queries/prepared statements. Implement proper input validation and sanitization.
sqli.description: SQL Injection allows attackers to interfere with database queries and access sensitive data.

lfi.recommendation: Validate and sanitize file paths. Use whitelisting for allowed files.
lfi.description: Local File Inclusion allows attackers to include files from the local server.

rfi.recommendation: Disable remote file inclusion. Validate and sanitize all file inputs.
rfi.description: Remote File Inclusion allows attackers to include files from remote servers.

xxe.recommendation: Disable external entity processing in XML parsers. Use secure XML parsing libraries.
xxe.description: XML External Entity attacks allow attackers to access local files and internal systems.

csrf.recommendation: Implement CSRF tokens. Use SameSite cookie attributes.
csrf.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery forces users to execute unwanted actions on authenticated applications.

idor.recommendation: Implement proper access controls and authorization checks.
idor.description: Insecure Direct Object Reference allows attackers to access unauthorized objects.

commandinjection.recommendation: Avoid executing system commands with user input. Use parameterized APIs.
commandinjection.description: Command Injection allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands on the host system.

pathtraversal.recommendation: Validate and sanitize file paths. Use whitelisting for allowed directories.
pathtraversal.description: Path Traversal allows attackers to access files outside the intended directory.

ldapinjection.recommendation: Use parameterized LDAP queries. Implement proper input validation.
ldapinjection.description: LDAP Injection allows attackers to modify LDAP queries and access unauthorized data.

nosqlinjection.recommendation: Use parameterized queries. Implement proper input validation and sanitization.
nosqlinjection.description: NoSQL Injection allows attackers to manipulate NoSQL database queries.

ssti.recommendation: Use safe template engines. Implement proper input validation and sandboxing.
ssti.description: Server-Side Template Injection allows attackers to inject malicious template code.

crlf.recommendation: Validate and sanitize all user inputs. Encode special characters.
crlf.description: CRLF Injection allows attackers to inject carriage return and line feed characters.

htmlinjection.recommendation: Implement proper HTML encoding and Content Security Policy (CSP).
htmlinjection.description: HTML Injection allows attackers to inject malicious HTML content.

textinjection.recommendation: Implement proper input validation and output encoding.
textinjection.description: Text Injection allows attackers to inject malicious text content.

secheaders.recommendation: Configure proper security headers to protect against common attacks.
secheaders.description: Missing security headers leave applications vulnerable to various attacks.

httponlycookies.recommendation: Set HttpOnly, Secure, and SameSite flags on all cookies.
httponlycookies.description: Insecure cookie configuration allows attackers to steal session tokens.

ssltls.recommendation: Use strong TLS configuration with modern cipher suites.
ssltls.description: Weak SSL/TLS configuration allows attackers to intercept communications.

cors.recommendation: Configure CORS policy properly. Avoid using wildcard origins.
cors.description: CORS misconfiguration allows unauthorized cross-origin requests.

clickjacking.recommendation: Implement X-Frame-Options or CSP frame-ancestors directive.
clickjacking.description: Clickjacking allows attackers to trick users into clicking hidden elements.

fileupload.recommendation: Validate file types, scan for malware, and store uploads securely.
fileupload.description: Unrestricted file upload allows attackers to upload malicious files.

jwt.recommendation: Use strong signing algorithms and validate JWT tokens properly.
jwt.description: JWT vulnerabilities allow attackers to forge or manipulate tokens.

deserialization.owasp: A08:2021 – Software and Data Integrity Failures
deserialization.recommendation: Avoid deserializing untrusted data. Use safe serialization formats.
deserialization.description: Insecure deserialization allows attackers to execute arbitrary code.

responsesplitting.recommendation: Validate and sanitize all user inputs used in HTTP responses.
responsesplitting.description: HTTP Response Splitting allows attackers to inject malicious HTTP responses.

dirbrute.recommendation: Restrict access to sensitive directories and files. Implement proper access controls.
dirbrute.description: Directory and file enumeration allows attackers to discover hidden resources and sensitive information.

git.recommendation: Remove .git directories from web-accessible locations. Use proper deployment practices.
git.description: Exposed Git repositories can reveal source code, credentials, and sensitive configuration data.

gitexposed.recommendation: Remove .git directories from web-accessible locations. Use proper deployment practices.
gitexposed.description: Exposed Git repositories can reveal source code, credentials, and sensitive configuration data.

dirtraversal.recommendation: Validate and sanitize file paths. Use whitelisting for allowed directories.
dirtraversal.description: Directory Traversal allows attackers to access files outside the intended directory structure.

ssrf.recommendation: Validate and whitelist allowed URLs. Implement network segmentation.
ssrf.description: Server-Side Request Forgery allows attackers to make requests from the server to internal or external resources.

versiondisclosure.recommendation: Remove or obfuscate version information from HTTP headers and error messages.
versiondisclosure.description: Version disclosure provides attackers with information about software versions that may have known vulnerabilities.

passwordoverhttp.recommendation: Use HTTPS for all authentication forms and sensitive data transmission.
passwordoverhttp.description: Transmitting passwords over HTTP allows attackers to intercept credentials in transit.

outdatedsoftware.recommendation: Keep all software components up to date. Implement vulnerability management processes.
outdatedsoftware.description: Outdated software components may contain known security vulnerabilities.

databaseerrors.owasp: A09:2021 – Security Logging and Monitoring Failures
databaseerrors.recommendation: Implement proper error handling. Avoid exposing database error messages to users.
databaseerrors.description: Database error messages can reveal sensitive information about the application structure and data.

phpinfo.recommendation: Remove phpinfo() pages from production environments.
phpinfo.description: PHPInfo pages expose detailed server configuration information that can aid attackers.

technology.recommendation: Minimize technology fingerprinting. Remove unnecessary headers and signatures.
technology.description: Technology detection provides attackers with information about the technology stack used.

openredirect.recommendation: Validate redirect URLs against a whitelist of allowed domains.
openredirect.description: Open Redirect allows attackers to redirect users to malicious websites.

hpp.recommendation: Implement proper parameter parsing and validation. Handle duplicate parameters consistently.
hpp.description: HTTP Parameter Pollution allows attackers to manipulate application logic through parameter confusion.

reversetabnabbing.recommendation: Add rel='noopener noreferrer' to external links with target='_blank'.
reversetabnabbing.description: Reverse Tabnabbing allows malicious websites to manipulate the original page through window.opener.

insecurereflection.recommendation: Implement proper output encoding and Content Security Policy (CSP).
insecurereflection.description: Insecure content reflection can lead to XSS vulnerabilities when user input is reflected without proper encoding.

phpconfig.recommendation: Configure PHP with secure settings. Disable dangerous functions and features.
phpconfig.description: Insecure PHP configuration can expose the application to various security risks.

csp.recommendation: Implement a strict Content Security Policy to prevent XSS and other injection attacks.
csp.description: Missing or weak Content Security Policy allows various injection attacks to succeed.

mixedcontent.recommendation: Ensure all resources are loaded over HTTPS on HTTPS pages.
mixedcontent.description: Mixed content vulnerabilities allow attackers to intercept or modify resources loaded over HTTP on HTTPS pages.

hostheader.recommendation: Validate Host header values. Use a whitelist of allowed hosts.
hostheader.description: Host Header Injection allows attackers to manipulate server behavior through malicious Host headers.

prototypepollution.owasp: A08:2021 – Software and Data Integrity Failures
prototypepollution.recommendation: Validate object properties. Use Object.create(null) or Map for data storage.
prototypepollution.description: Prototype Pollution allows attackers to modify JavaScript object prototypes, potentially leading to RCE.

vhost.recommendation: Properly configure virtual hosts. Avoid default catch-all configurations.
vhost.description: Virtual Host discovery can reveal hidden applications and services on the same server.

infoleak.owasp: A09:2021 – Security Logging and Monitoring Failures
infoleak.recommendation: Remove sensitive information from public responses. Implement proper error handling.
infoleak.description: Information leakage exposes sensitive data such as email addresses, internal IPs, or debug information.
